title: SSE Business Energy is sponsoring Net Zero Leaders at TELCA 2020 – and here’s the shortlist…
lead: This year, our industry-recognised awards show is taking place online on the 11th of December

title: Helping you find the right electricity supplier for your business
lead: It’s commonplace for businesses to switch electricity suppliers to help them save money and achieve greater sustainability. Yet finding the right one can seem daunting. This becomes more difficult if you’re looking to get more from your energy usage or putting your electricity contract out to tender for the first time.

title: New project to help catalyse affordable green housing finance in India
lead: Green buildings are expected to help save more than 20% on energy and water consumption compared to typical buildings

title: Four people die after explosion at sewage plant near Bristol
lead: Avon and Somerset Police said three Wessex Water employees and one contractor were killed

title: UK steps up emissions goals to require a 68% reduction by 2030
lead: The ambitious goal comes despite the CCC having previously warned the government that the UK is not on track to hit its existing fifth carbon budget target

title: Almost 80% of consumers to ‘change their heating habits this winter to reduce bills’
lead: Nearly 45% of homeowners are more likely to monitor energy consumption more closely, according to a new report

title: Major incident declared after large chemical tank explosion at sewage works in Bristol
lead: The police confirmed there has been a number of casualties as a result of the explosion

title: Electrification paired with renewables ‘could help China achieve carbon-neutrality goal’
lead: Under a faster energy transition scenario, China would require $7.9 trillion worth of investment in electricity generation capacity, according to a new report

title: HD video streaming on phone ‘creates eight times more emissions than SD’
lead: Keeping the audio and turning off the video content on YouTube could save between 1% and 5% of the service’s total emissions, according to a new report

title: Offshore wind target of 1,400GW by 2050 ‘could save $1.88 trillion in public health costs’
lead: The goal is achievable if governments work together with industry to set out stable policies and pipeline visibility, according to a new report
